description: Introduction to MEMS and NEMS technologies: MEMS/NEMS applications and key commercial success stories (accelerometers, gyroscopes, digital light projectors, resonators). Review of micromachining techniques and MEMS/NEMS fabrication approaches. Actuation methods in MEMS and NEMS, MEMS/NEMS design and modeling. Examples of MEMS/NEMS components from industry and academia. Case studies: MEMS inertial sensors, microscale mirrors, micro and nano resonators, micro and nano switches, MEMS/NEMS chem/bio sensors, MEMS gyroscopes, MEMS microphones.

values.comments:
Introduction to MEMS and NEMS technologies: MEMS/NEMS applications and key commercial success stories (accelerometers, gyroscopes, digital light projectors, resonators). Review of micromachining techniques and MEMS/NEMS fabrication approaches. Actuation methods in MEMS and NEMS, MEMS/NEMS design and modeling. Examples of MEMS/NEMS components from industry and academia. Case studies: MEMS inertial sensors, microscale mirrors, micro and nano resonators, micro and nano switches, MEMS/NEMS chem/bio sensors, MEMS gyroscopes, MEMS microphones.

Students generally liked the course, which demonstrated lots of “cool and practical applications” of MEMS. One student described it as a “pretty basic introduction” to the subject material and stated that it would not be as enjoyable if it was taken just to fulfill the requirement. The final project was a good way to sum up the curriculum of the course.

Overall, students were satisfied with Professor Piazza, but one student felt that he needed to better ensure that everyone in class could follow his lecturing.

There were five homework assignments, which were weighted differently, the latter three being based on in-class demos. In addition, there was a midterm examination and a final group project.

This course review is based on the 5 student comments that were submitted.
